benchmark_details.name: Rinas
benchmark_details.overview: Rinas is a data loading framework designed to efficiently load large shuffled datasets for model training, enhancing overall training throughput without compromising accuracy.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To increase the training efficiency of models on large shuffled datasets through a novel data loading framework.

data.source: Various large datasets including ImageNet, C4, RedPajama, and more.
data.size: From 140 GB to 10 TB depending on dataset.
data.format: Varied, including structured and unstructured data formats.

methods: Baseline comparisons against existing data loading frameworks
methodology.calculation: Throughput calculated by dividing the total number of samples processed by the total time taken.
methodology.interpretation: Higher throughput indicates better performance and efficiency of the data loading process.
methodology.baseline_results: Training throughput improved by up to 89% for vision models and 59% for language models compared to existing frameworks.
methodology.validation: Evaluations conducted on multiple standard datasets across different model training scenarios.
